text: William Lassell (18 June 1799 â€“ 5 October 1880) was a British astronomer, born in Bolton, Lancashire, England. He died in Maidenhead in 1880. He is known as discoverer of Triton, the largest moon of Neptune, and for his improvements to the reflecting telescope. Lassell, William Category:1799 births Category:1880 deaths
title: William Lassell
